means: 知识（表示多方面的知识时有复数knowledges这一用法）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"知识，学问"之意。
means: knowledge ： 强调对全部已知或可知的知识的理解。
learning ： 指通过研究、经验或他人传授而得到的知识；也指熟练掌握知识的过程，有时可指全部学识和智慧的总和。
scholarship ： 侧重指经过深入学习、研究而获得的渊博的、价值较高的知识。

sentence.Network_en: Father had no more than a superficial knowledge of music.

sentence.Network_en: He did not get a chance to deepen his knowledge of Poland.
sentence.Network_cn: 他没有机会更深入地了解波兰。

sentence.Network_en: To the young boy his father was the fount of all knowledge.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于这个小男孩儿来说，他的父亲就是所有知识的源泉。

means.word_mean: 意识,知觉,确信,深信,信念,信条,预知,先见
认识,了解,展示,揭露,承认

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (originally as a verb in the sense 'acknowledge, recognize', later as a noun): from an Old English compound based on cnāwan (see know)

entry.def: Knowledge is information and understanding about a subject which a person has, or which all people have.

example.ex: She told Parliament she had no knowledge of the affair.
example.tran: 她告诉议会她对此事并不知情。

entry.def: If you say that something is true to your knowledge or to the best of your knowledge, you mean that you believe it to be true but it is possible that you do not know all the facts.

example.ex: Alec never carried a gun to my knowledge...
example.tran: 据我所知亚历克从来不带枪。

example.ex: To the best of my knowledge, Gloria did not make these comments.
example.tran: 据我所知，格洛丽亚没这么说过。

entry.def: If you do something safe in the knowledge that something else is the case, you do the first thing confidently because you are sure of the second thing.

example.ex: You can let your kids play here, safe in the knowledge that they won't get sunburn.
example.tran: 你可以放心让孩子们在这儿玩，他们肯定不会晒黑。

means.word_mean: 1. the psychological result of perception and learning and reasoning

Sentence.sentence: What characterizes a knowledge economy according to the passage?
Solid background knowledge in a particular field
Is creativity a natural gift like good looks, or is it something that can be acquired like knowledge?
Unfortunately,many American universities seem awfully busy protecting their brand name and not nearly busy enough protecting the pursuit of knowledge.
As American research universities begin to resemble profit centers and entertainment complexes, it's easy to lose sight of their primary mission; to produce and spread knowledge

sentences.en: He denied any knowledge of them.

sentences.en: He is limited in an up-to-date knowledge.
He is poor in money, but rich in knowledge.
sentences.cn: 他贫于金钱, 但富于学问。

jushi.english: This is a significant contribution to knowledge.
jushi.chinese: 这是对知识的重大贡献。

jushi.english: He was very sad to the knowledge that his wife was killed in an air crash.
jushi.chinese: 得知妻子在飞机失事中丧生,他非常难过。

jushi.english: Probably it will be useful for them to acquire a practical knowledge of English.
jushi.chinese: 英语的实际知识可能对他们很有用。
